intro: Dasiphora imitatrix, commonly known as the mimic barren strawberry, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, hairy stems and produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Its leaves are alternate and trifoliate, with three leaflets that are elliptic in shape. Dasiphora imitatrix is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
